abstract: Nan Goldin's "Scopophilia" is showing at the Matthew Marks Gallery in Manhattan. Randy Kennedy interviewed Ms. Goldin for Thursday's Arts section.
snippet: Nan Goldin's "Scopophilia" is showing at the Matthew Marks Gallery in Manhattan. Randy Kennedy interviewed Ms. Goldin for Thursday's Arts section.
lead_paragraph: Thursday's Arts pages feature Randy Kennedy's interview with Nan Goldin, who is known for her photographs of "life lived at full tilt, of addiction and physical abuse, of friends and lovers ravaged by AIDS and other afflictions," as Mr. Kennedy writes.
